solution_line_template: First find the current rate the hose pumps by multiplying its normal rate by {restriction_fraction}: {normal_pump_rate} gallons/minute * {restriction_fraction} = <<{normal_pump_rate}*{restriction_fraction}={current_pump_rate}>>{current_pump_rate} gallons/minute

Then divide the number of gallons in the pond by the number of gallons pumped each minute to find how many minutes filling the pond takes: {pond_capacity} gallons / {current_pump_rate} gallons/minute = <<{pond_capacity}/{current_pump_rate}={time_to_fill}>>{time_to_fill} minutes
